poem:
Title: "Morning Musings on Distant Turmoils"

Awaking from sleep, news of distance wars teems,
Nations sitting on edge, as morning's light gleams.
100 billion, they say, a small price to pay,
For freedom's song on Ukraine's steadfast bay.
Yet, the human cost is never quite clear,
As battlefront echoes drum in my ear.
I turn my pen - the poet's sword, 
Questioning, will peace ever be restored?
